title: I just hate Nasus
body: He's just boring to play against and is aggravating to deal with. I would go into a whole page worth of my problems with him, but I'm frankly too annoyed at the moment after dealing with him again. If anyone has any opinions on him, feel free to sound off below.

Other than the fact that yeah you have to stop him from free-farming which often means Don't Roam. but if your someone like oohh.. idk.. the devil himself.... Nasus is scared of being shot in the face with a dart that puts a cloud of darkness around his face.... so he can't farm. honestly with nasus you just have to counter pick.

My biggest problem is Spirit FIre. Why does he get such high damage, AOE DOT harass with a slow? He already has a super intense slow. At least make him use wither to make it effective. Also, why the fuck is it so much damage? If he maxes it first, he can basically force his counters out of lane. Which is really stupid.

> [{quoted}](name=The AFK Farmer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=judgn5E8,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2015-03-26T19:22:47.293+0000)

Also, why the fuck is it so much damage? If he maxes it first, he can basically force his counters out of lane. Which is really stupid.

Because it costs massive amounts of mana, pushes the lane on a champion that needs to melee range last hit to be relevant later AND is easily gankable, and doesn't do a large amount of damage unless you continue to stand in it.

Initial Damage: 55 / 95 / 135 / 175 / 215 

So it'll be rank 4 at level 7 if you max it. So if you're a squishy marksman with a blind, you only HAVE 950 health. Just catching you on the edge of it takes out 18% of your health. Do that 3 times in a row, and you'll still have enough mana to wither and Q for a gank from your jungler, meaning your "counter" has to let you free farm while they back or risk dying.

This is why I lose to Nasus. There is no counterplay to that spirit fire.

You can easily walk out of spirit fire for if your a marksman with a dash (Vayne's tumble) you can easily get out of it that way. And a good Nasus wouldn't use Spirit Fire in lane, cause it pushes the lane hence making him an easy gank and him missing out farm. And if your a Marksman you simply have the advantage of range and kite. Try it sometime? Get a QSS if your so irked by him?

I literally just said that the issue is the initial damage, not the dot...You can't "kite" instant AOE damage. QSS...is fine, I guess. Not really addressing the problem, but it's great for wither, I guess...?

And yes, he does use spirit fire in lane when he's countered, as the people above agreed with me with.
I'm starting to think everyone in this post wants Nasus to pounded by the nerf hammer... Or simply doesn't know how to play against him...

Basically fighting Nasus involves 1 of 2 things.

2) Nasus is fed; he has no meaningful range or hard CC and can only run right up to you, so just avoid him and play around him.

> [{quoted}](name=JacctheInsomniac,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=judgn5E8,comment-id=0014000000000000,timestamp=2015-03-27T04:33:57.893+0000)
>
> Nasus makes all champions immobile unless you have a hard escape.
> 
> And if you rely on autoattacks for any amount of damage, then have fun not dealing any.
> 
> Yea he's immobile, and if he didn't have a snare (oops sorry, 5 second 90% movespeed and attack speed slow with a 6-7 Second cooldown at max CDR.) Then he would not have a means to close the gap, but for gods sake he doesn't need THAT. 
> 
> He's not OP, he's just 100% anti fun. You don't get to leave your lane, push an advantage, or even kill him because of that lifesteal. And if he's ahead you have absolutely no hope, unless your mid laner (the only one who can deal damage to him through his slow.) can 100-0 him consistently in teamfights. He dictates the pace of a game just by BEING in the game, and that's never been fun.

Any form of CC is "anti-fun." It involves loss of character control, and thus it involves not playing the game for a duration.
We can't just take things like this out of the game. If we did that, everyone would be a Zed. Big numbers, "flashy" plays, kill counts out the wazoo because nobody can stop the other Zeds.

CC is essentially a necessary evil.

That being said, you **can** leave your lane, you **can** push an advantage, and you **can** kill him. He isn't a god (*remember, they retconned that*).

His lifesteal is good, but its the only reason he can even lane or jungle whatsoever. His wither is good, but its the only reason he's relevant late game, and its honestly not as powerful as a straight up stun (remember, stuns are 100% movement speed reduction, 100% attack speed reduction, and 100% ability lock-out). If you have any mobility, or your team has any of their own CC (hint hint), you can still peel away from him with ease when withered.

He's relatively balanced right now. Tipping the boat is a bad idea.

> [{quoted}](name=JacctheInsomniac,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=judgn5E8,comment-id=001400000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-03-27T05:58:13.032+0000)
>
> Nasus's slow is a greater detriment to a champions DPS than a stun. 
> Stuns cut their damage off completely, then it returns. And Stuns rarely last above 2 seconds. 
> It lasts 5 seconds and halves their attack speed. (Which is a multiplicative stat, so the total damage loss is greater than 50%.) So for 5 seconds you're dealing less than half the damage you deal per second.
> So basically either you deal  1.) > 50% of your DPS for 5 seconds. OR  2.) 100% of your DPS for 3 Seconds.
> 
> Meanwhile champions like Zed and Leblanc aren't even affected by Nasus's slow. They deal damage with abilities and dashes aren't affected by slows
> 
> I know how to counter Nasus, the point is his whither doesn't just allow Nasus to reach you. It completely removes you from a fight.

It ramps up. You don't lose that much attack speed instantly. You lose that amount for **one second.** It doesn't remove you from the fight, only the last 2-3~ seconds are really particularly noteworthy-- roughly the same duration as a stun. It does hurt your DPS, but that is its intention. To reduce the damage of an ADC, which melts him late game anyways. That being said, you say you know how to deal with wither, so it really shouldn't be a problem. A good team won't let Nasus wither an ADC, well. Essentially ever.

His passive is the only thing that allows him to even lane or jungle period, and his Q is the only reason he has any kind of scaling.
ADC's have crit to scale.
Mages have deathcap and AP scalings.
Assassins have armor-pen stacking and generally some sorta steroid.
Tanks have boatloads of CC and %HP damage on basic abilities.
Nasus has his Q and Wither.

Plus, Nasus is one of the few champions in the game, that if he is denied, loses pretty heavily two-fold (despite what everyone cries about, where he turns into this monster if he's left alone after losing lane. Hint hint, if you let any champion free-farm they get obnoxiously strong, you gave away your lead like a baddie)

Nasus **needs** items, and Nasus **needs** Q stacks. If you deny him minions, he loses two-fold. He doesn't have the gold he needs to function, and he doesn't have any damage and is permanently behind in that regard (he can't magically make more minions to farm show up).

> [{quoted}](name=Sirsir94,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=judgn5E8,comment-id=000d,timestamp=2015-03-26T20:57:45.558+0000)

I don't think he would be... You can't take things out of a relatively balanced champion's kit and not compensate them pretty significantly.
 He'd be pretty terrible unless they decided to replace what he lost with a hard-CC. Every other tank has hard CC, he has a ramping slow (goes from 35% to 95%) and a similarly ramping (17% to 47.5%) attack speed slow. Honestly if you nerfed wither, he'd be useless as a champion. He'd have no way to mitigate damage, and he'd have no way to catch anyone or CC anyone meaningfully.

Actually Nasus is more of a fighter/bruiser then a tank...
While yes even if Nasus is really farmed... if he gets kited in teamfights he pretty much turns into a bad tank with meh tank steroids and no initiation and mediocre CC (only a single target slow.. most other tank have some powerful AoE CC)
Since Nasus damage is irrelevant if he doesn't get to use it

he's not op because you are able to make a nasus cry in a corner for picking nasus. But the fact that he changes toplane into a babysitting lane where both you and the jungle have to waste time in that lane is why people hate him even if they're destroying him in lane. 
The biggest problem is that his passive allows him to get bullied hardcore but as long as you don't get tower dove, you can heal back from the wave at your tower so it's really hard to stop nasus instead of delaying him, also his ult will stop an early tower dive and possibly get him a kill.

Even if you don't crush nasus in lane... as long as you have a decent team composition with some CC and peel... then in teamfights and Nasus often ends up as a tank with mediocre CC and no initiation (as Nasus damage doesn't matter much if he doesn't get to anyone)

Though Nasus is pretty good at split pushing and 1v1 (Though he usually isn't so good at getting away if caught in a tight spot... though it usually takes a while to kill him so be careful you don't give the enemy team objectives or important things while you send people after Nasus)

Counterplaying Nasus is easy: just harass him when he goes in to last-hit with Q. Better yet, if you have a way to make him miss his Q (a blind, a stun, shielding the minion he's hitting, or a Shen taunt) it's completely wasted. Champions who destroy him include: Vlad, Shen, Taric, Quinn, Teemo, Ryze... I'd think Darius too, since he just destroys almost every melee champion early, 

Also don't push your lane. Nasus LOVES to farm under his tower.

Darius would do well against Nasus, but he shoves the lane so hard with his Q that eventually the advantage will go to the doge. Not to mention Nasus has crazy sustain where Darius has absolutely none.
